title: The Must-Try Alternative Wellness Therapies in Hong Kong for Instant Relaxation
author: Jianne Soriano
description: On the hunt for the best wellness therapy? From fork therapy, Japanese acupuncture, and numerology—here are alternative ways of healing in the city.
cleaned_text: Are you on the hunt for the best wellness therapy? From fork therapy, Japanese acupuncture, and reiki meditation--we're listing alternative ways of healing available in the city Hong Kong has nothing short of [wellness](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/luxury-hong-kong-wellness-retreats-staycation) options--from [spa treatments](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/beauty/5-beauty-brand-spas-in-hong-kong) and [yoga studios](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/best-yoga-studios-in-hong-kong), to activities such as [forest bathing](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/forest-bathing-shinrin-yoku-wellness-therapy). But there are other ways that you might not have heard of. If you're looking for the best healing method that works for you, or if you just want to have a go at something new, we've listed some alternative wellness therapies to try in the city. Don't miss: [Why are Mushrooms the Biggest Beauty and Wellness Trend Right Now?](https://www.tatlerasia.com/style/wellness/mushroom-beauty) 1. Fork Therapy Fork therapy is a non-invasive therapy that produces deep and penetrating sound effects which help the body and mind [relax](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/hong-kong-wellness-classes-to-relax-mind-and-body), release tension, maintain [calm](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/easy-breathing-exercises-techniques-to-relax-and-destress), and also enhance emotional balance. This type of therapy uses sound to help facilitate changes in our brainwaves causing the vibration and frequency to alleviate our energy. Fork therapy uses Angel Turners, a unique set of three high pitched tuning forks and that helps vibrate your cranial bones, putting you into a meditative state.
